value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Using Single Sign-on with the Power BI Gateway
value.excerpt: Let's dig into the Power BI gateway and Single Sign-On (SSO) using Kerberos!  This can be used for both DirectQuery and refreshing a Power BI dataset.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-sso-overview  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

In this webinar we will be reviewing the following topics:  - What is DAX Studio?  - Why should I use DAX Studio?  - Getting started and connecting DAX Studio to various

value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/a4kPkOAYOvg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how you can use GROUPBY function in DAX to create an aggregated table. In this video, I'll explain how you can use Summarize function for the same purpose. Summarize function gives you more control on how to create your aggregated table with some extra functions. Let's
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6Lvy4S_EnAY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. You need to learn how to reference columns, and tables. what operators can be used, and what are the very simple basics of writing a DAX expression. In
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/GVAzp-YICnQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Calculating Stock on Hand Using DAX   Power BI Inventory Model
value.excerpt: You don't have always the luxury of having a snapshot fact table that has the stock on hand value for every single day, at every single workshop, and for every single product. Even if you want to build such a table, it can get easily gigantic. In this video, I am going to show you how you can use DAX
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Wr4o5uneFxc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Change Excel Source in Power BI to OneDrive for Business   No Gateway Needed
value.excerpt: If you used an excel file in a local source (or even OneDrive for Business, but sourced locally), you need to do one extra step to make your query refreshable without the need to the gateway. Here in this video, I‚Äôll explain an easy way to do that change.  Step by step guide is also explained here in
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/uxMlV9KKf6E" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Compare Period Over Period Breakdown in Power BI Using the Waterfall Chart
value.excerpt: The Waterfall chart is a good visualization to show you changes on value over a sequence, The sequence can be time, or date or workflow steps, etc. There is also an ability in this chart that may not be visible to everyone, and that is the breakdown option of this chart. You can use the chart without

value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. value.title: Dataflow Vs  Dataset   What are the Differences of these two Power BI Components

So I thought better to explain it in a post and help everyone in that understanding. In this video, you will learn what the differences between these

value.title: How to organize workspaces in a Power BI environment
